sen.j: 大江忠成（おおえ ただなり）は鎌倉時代の武士。
sen.e: Tadanari OE was a "samurai" in the Kamakura period.
Tadanari OE was a samurai in the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: ここでのクォーツは不必要と思われ、削除しました。
sen.e: Tadanari OE was a samurai in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 海東判官大江忠成、海東忠成。
sen.e: He was called Kaito hangan (inspector (third highest of the four administrative ranks of the ritsuryo period) Tadanari or Tadashige KAITO.
sen.cmt: 忠成は、ただなり と ただしげ の 二通りの読み方があるようです。
sen.e: He was called Kaito hangan (inspector, third highest of the four administrative ranks of the ritsuryo period) Tadanari or Tadashige KAITO.
sen.cmt: カッコ内を修正しました。
sen.e: He was called Kaito hangan (inspector, third highest of the four administrative ranks of the ritsuryo period) Tadanari or Tadashige KAITO.
He was the fifth son of OE no Hiromoto.
He was the fifth son of OE no Hiromoto.
He was the fifth son of OE no Hiromoto.

sen.j: 広元から三河国海東庄を与えられ、定住する。
sen.e: Tadnari was given Kaito-sho estate in Mikawa Province from Hiromoto and settled down.
Tadanari was given Kaito-sho estate in Mikawa Province from Hiromoto, and settled down.
sen.cmt: Tadnari→Tadanari,カッコを挿入しました。
sen.e: Tadanari was given Kaito-sho estate in Mikawa Province from Hiromoto, and settled down.

sen.j: その後尾張国の熱田大宮司の養子となる。
sen.e: After that, he was adopted by Atsuta Daiguji (the highest priest serving at Atsuta Shrine in Owari Province).
Later, he was adopted by Atsuta Daiguji (the highest priest serving at Atsuta-jingu Shrine in Owari Province).
sen.cmt: After that→Later,スペースの修正、Atsuta Shrine→Atsuta-jingu Shrine （用語集の訳と異なりますが、”熱田神宮”部分を修正しました）
sen.e: Later, he was adopted by Atsuta Daiguji (the highest priest serving at Atsuta-jingu Shrine in Owari Province).

sen.j: 忠成の末裔は三河酒井氏の祖となった。
sen.e: The descendant of Tadanari became the founder of the Mikawa Sakai clan.
The descendant of Tadanari became the founder of the Mikawa Sakai clan.
The descendant of Tadanari became the founder of the Mikawa Sakai clan.
